'''Noel Yee''' is an American flow arts educator, theorist, and community organizer. He is the primary creator of the [[Vulcan Tech Gospel]] (VTG) and co-creator of [[Transition Theory]] with [[Jordan Campbell]]. He is a co-founder of the [[Flow Arts Institute]], [[FireDrums]], [[Kinetic Fire]], and the [[Vulcan Crew]].<ref name="noel-about">{{cite web |url=https://noelyee.com/about-me/ |title=About Me |publisher=Noel Yee}}</ref>

== Background ==

Yee has a background in science education for children, which informed his systematic approach to flow arts pedagogy. He has over 11 years of teaching experience and serves as a board member of the [[International Jugglers' Association]] (IJA).<ref name="noel-about" /><ref name="drex-profile">{{cite web |url=https://www.patreon.com/posts/profiles-in-poi-1920634 |title=Profiles in Poi: Noel Yee |publisher=DrexFactor Patreon}}</ref>

Yee learned poi from Matt Terry and from [[Nick Woolsey]]'s videos.<ref name="sticksout-1">{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ymyQmKJi04Y&t=173s |title=STICKSOUT PODCAST#1 - Nick Woolsey |author=Noel Yee |access-date=2026-02-11 |at=2:53}}</ref> His YouTube channel name references the ''Dune'' novels.<ref name="loft-show-dune">{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dlQNXqOM4Ns&t=279s |title=Loft Show episode #1: Noel Yee and Cassie McKenny! |author=Noel Yee |access-date=2026-02-11 |at=4:39}}</ref>

== Contributions ==

=== Vulcan Tech Gospel ===

{{main|Vulcan Tech Gospel}}

Yee compiled and developed the VTG framework at the [[Vulcan Lofts]] in Oakland, California, with contributions from [[Jordan Campbell]], [[David Cantor|David "Tankboy" Cantor]], and [[Brian Thompson]]. VTG classifies the relationships between two spinning objects using [[timing and direction]], snapshots (prop facing), and pattern shape.<ref name="vtg-main">{{cite web |url=https://noelyee.com/instruction/vulcan-tech-gospel/ |title=Vulcan Tech Gospel |publisher=Noel Yee}}</ref>

Yee documented 40 patterns in the VTG 1:1 ratio set.<ref name="noel-40">{{cite web |url=https://noelyee.com/vtg-11-necessity-of-40-patterns/ |title=VTG 1:1 Necessity of 40 Patterns |publisher=Noel Yee}}</ref>

=== Transition Theory ===

{{main|Transition Theory}}

In 2010, Yee and [[Jordan Campbell]] formalized [[Transition Theory]], which describes how spinners move between different pattern states using soft, hard, and mixed transitions. Yee described this as the development that "settled the core dogma of VTG."<ref name="transition-theory">{{cite web |url=https://noelyee.com/transition-theory-with-noel-yee/ |title=Transition Theory with Noel Yee |publisher=Noel Yee}}</ref>

=== VTG App ===

Yee collaborated with Michael Pike to develop the VTG app, available on iOS and Android, which provides animations and descriptions for learning VTG patterns across multiple prop types.<ref name="vtg-android">{{cite web |url=https://noelyee.com/vulcan-tech-gospel-android-app/ |title=Vulcan Tech Gospel Android App |publisher=Noel Yee}}</ref>

=== Hoop VTG ===

Yee worked with [[Cassie McKenney]] and Maiki Nope to adapt VTG for [[hoops]], covering prop facing and grip shifts specific to the prop.<ref name="hoop-vtg">{{cite web |url=https://noelyee.com/hoop-vtg-11-with-cassie-mckenney/ |title=Hoop VTG 1:1 with Cassie McKenney |publisher=Noel Yee}}</ref>

== Media ==

=== NOELTECH ===

Yee produces the '''NOELTECH''' YouTube series, with 74+ episodes covering tech poi, contact juggling, buugeng, staff, and various other techniques.<ref name="noeltech">{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cMNlx0lLOVk |title=NOELTECH # 1: Together Time Same Direction |author=Noel Yee |access-date=2026-02-11}}</ref>

=== The Loft Show ===

'''The Loft Show''' is a content series filmed from Yee's loft bed at [[Vulcan Lofts]].<ref name="loft-show">{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dlQNXqOM4Ns |title=Loft Show episode #1: Noel Yee and Cassie McKenny! |author=Noel Yee |access-date=2026-02-11}}</ref>

=== Patreon ===

Yee runs a Patreon tutorial series with at least six episodes of instructional content, covering topics such as fujimi, buugeng, and 3-ball on body.<ref name="patreon-tut1">{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mGRtF6Y1J1w |title=Patreon Tutorial #1: Fujimi |author=Noel Yee |access-date=2026-02-11}}</ref><ref name="patreon-tut4">{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SkQXLaxp28k |title=NOELTECH PATREON TUT#4 BUUGENG |author=Noel Yee |access-date=2026-02-11}}</ref>
